required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Discretionary Food Sources and Stress Perception
clinical_study.official_title: Discretionary Food Sources and Stress Perception

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock:
Purpose:
The objective of this study is to determine the effect different sources and forms of discretionary foods have on stress perception in healthy adults in a free living, real world setting.
Rationale:
The rationale for conducting this study is to test the effects of sugar-sweetened beverages and grain-based desserts have on perceived health and stress perception, since the evidence for this topic is limited.

primary_outcome.description: A questionnaire adapted from the SF-12 will be used to measure stress perception.

secondary_outcome.description: A digital scale will be used to measure body weight.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Solid: Grain based desserts and candy consumption
arm_group.description: Consumption of grain based desserts and/or candy

intervention.arm_group_label: Solid: Grain based desserts and candy consumption

intervention.intervention_name: Solid: Grain based desserts and candy consumption
intervention.description: Grain based desserts and candy consumption
intervention.arm_group_label: Solid: Grain based desserts and candy consumption

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults who consume sugar sweetened beverages and grain based desserts and candy on a regular basis
- Free from major illnesses or chronic disease
- Willing to consume amount of beverages and food provided to supplement usual dietary habits during each period
Exclusion Criteria:
- Recently lost a significant amount or looking to lose weight
- Recently begun a new diet or exercise regimen
- Pregnant or nursing women
- Report restrained eater or having less than 51% control over food preparation

overall_official.affiliation: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

facility.name: University of Minnesota West Bank Office Building
